definition: to make an appointment/to invite/approximately/pact/treaty/to economize/to restrict/to reduce (a fraction)/concise
to weigh in a balance or on a scale

sentences.english: He is punctual. He never breaks his words.
Nothing is more irritating than being stood up.
sentences.chinese: 没有一件事比苦等爽约的人更令人气恼的了。

sentences.english: No, I won't break the appointment.
Last year his moment of glory came when John McCain cancelled on him.
sentences.chinese: 去年当麦凯恩爽约，他的光辉时刻便来临了。

sentences.english: Remind your partner that it’s better to decline a task than to break a promise.
sentences.chinese: 提醒你的伴儿，有时候推掉一件事比爽约要好。

sentences.english: Not many believers left after the 2009 verdict.
sentences.chinese: 自2009年他们爽约之后相信他们的人就不多了。

definition: to reschedule/to rearrange (e.g. a meeting)/to postpone
to break a promise/to violate an agreement/to default (on a loan or contract)
to restrict/to agree to a contract/offer/bid
to reject/to refuse to take a call
old: to reap the consequences of one's words (idiom, from Mencius); modern: to go back on one's word/to blow hot and cold/to contradict oneself/inconsistent
to arrive as planned/right on schedule
to leave early (before the stipulated finishing time)/to retire early (from one's job)
